body_html:
Has anyone tried using tf-records to train a keras model with multiple inputs?
I'm trying to train a keras model with multiple inputs using tfrecords.
The number of samples in both the inputs are the same but the 4th dimension is different. One input is an optical flow(along x and y axes (so two dimension)) and the other is a frame(with three color channels).

ValueError: Dimension 3 in both shapes must be equal, but are 2 and 3. Shapes are [10,240,320,2] and [10,240,320,3].
From merging shape 0 with other shapes. for 'stack_1' (op: 'Pack') with input shapes: [10,240,320,2], [10,240,320,3].

Any ideas on how i can proceed?

body:
Has anyone tried using tf-records to train a keras model with multiple inputs?
I'm trying to train a keras model with multiple inputs using tfrecords.
The number of samples in both the inputs are the same but the 4th dimension is different. One input is an optical flow(along x and y axes (so two dimension)) and the other is a frame(with three color channels).

ValueError: Dimension 3 in both shapes must be equal, but are 2 and 3. Shapes are [10,240,320,2] and [10,240,320,3].
From merging shape 0 with other shapes. for 'stack_1' (op: 'Pack') with input shapes: [10,240,320,2], [10,240,320,3].

Any ideas on how i can proceed?
